content.text:
Maybe later I'll write a more exhaustive "guide on how to interact with me" but I was reading [@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519)'s post and it reminded me of a cool thing.

A while ago I was trying to work on some things with mix and at one point he sent me a message (public? I can't find it anywhere) that said something like:

"hey I noticed that I've been reaching out lots but you haven't really been hitting the ball back over the fence"

I think there was some other stuff about scheduling that specific thing, but I really cherish that message. It kind of sucked to read but it was also *awesome* because he cared enough to be honest with me and point to a thing I hadn't really been aware of. I don't know how to translate this into a solid "interface guide" but I suppose I want to highlight the data point as a Thing You Should Do, because it really meant a lot to me.

#interface-guide
